thread.title: United Airlines delivers on sneak peek at its newest aircraft
thread.title_full: United Airlines delivers on sneak peek at its newest aircraft

author: Lewis Lazare
title: United Airlines delivers on sneak peek at its newest aircraft
text:
United Airlines delivers on sneak peek at its newest aircraft Jul 21, 2015, 12:52pm CDT Share DonMotzJr The Airbus 350 touched down at Chicago's O'Hare International Airport Friday afternoon. Right on schedule , United Airlines (NYSE: UAL) gave Chicago a sneak look at its new widebody Airbus 350 aircraft Friday afternoon. Airbus' latest creation, meant to compete with Chicago-based Boeing's 787 Dreamliner, won't enter United's fleet until 2018. But that didn't stop United from showing off the plane to invited guests and airline employees in a hangar at Chicago's O'Hare International Airport a full three years early. The A 350-1000 model United will get is a stretch version of the A 350-900 that already is part of the Qatar Airways fleet. American Airlines (NASDAQ: AAL) and Delta Air Lines (NYSE: DAL) are expected be begin taking delivery of 900-series planes in 2017. But United Airlines will be the launch North American carrier for the stretch A 350-1000. Aside from its overall sleek appearance, the A 350's distinctive touches include its upturned winglets. The interior also sports upward-curving baggage compartments that help create a more spacious feeling. United's cabin configuration plans for the A 350-1000 are still being finalized, but there likely will be a premium and economy cabin layout. A United spokesman who toured the plane and took a short flight on the Airbus 350 last Friday described the experience this way: "Fantastic aircraft. It felt like being in the future for 90 minutes." 
Want Chicago Travel
